briefdescription.para: constructor with a segment and a point

parameterdescription.para: segment consist of triangle, first and second vertex points

briefdescription.para: check if this triangle is valid or not.
assign new segment and vertex point

parameterdescription.para: segment consist of triangle, first and second vertex points

simplesect.para: const reference to the member variable

briefdescription.para: get the area of this region
get a signed area. this method is equivalent to signed_area().

simplesect.para: signed area value If points a, b, c are placed counterclockwise order, returns positive number. If points a, b, c are placed clockwise order, returns negative number. If points a, b, c are placed on a line, returns 0.

briefdescription.para: get a double of signed area value. this method is equivalent to double_signed_area().

simplesect.para: double of signed area value If points a, b, c are placed counterclockwise order, returns positive number. If points a, b, c are placed clockwise order, returns negative number. If points a, b, c are placed on a line, returns 0.

briefdescription.para: check if this triangle's vertices are placed counterclockwise order.
get the center of gravity(centroid, JUU-SIN)
get the center of inscribed circle(NAI-SIN)
get the center of circumscribed circle(GAI-SIN)
calculate intersection point with line segment.
get a double signed area value (== area of parallelogram)

simplesect.para: double sined area value. If points a, b, c are placed counterclockwise order, returns positive number. If points a, b, c are placed clockwise order, returns negative number. If points a, b, c are placed on a line, returns 0.

signed area value If points a, b, c are placed counterclockwise order, returns positive number. If points a, b, c are placed clockwise order, returns negative number. If points a, b, c are placed on a line, returns 0.

briefdescription.para: check if input vertices are placed counterclockwise order.

detaileddescription.para:
a
triangle's 1st vertex
b
triangle's 2nd vertex
c
triangle's 3rd vertex
coordinates of gravity center
centroid = (a + b + c) / 3

a
triangle's 1st vertex
b
triangle's 2nd vertex
c
triangle's 3rd vertex
coordinates of orthocenter
orthocenter = a + b + c - 2 * circumcenter
